revision.text:
The '''Motor Bus Society''' (MBS) is a [[United States]]-based [[non-profit organization]] formed by a [[voluntary association]] of persons who share an interest in [[bus]]es and [[bus transport]]ation in [[North America]] and, in particular, the history of the same. Founded in 1948, it publishes the quarterly magazine, ''Motor Coach Age'', and holds a national convention semi-annually for its members.<ref name="oregonian">{{cite news|last=Stewart|first=Bill|date=October 2, 2000|title=Motor Bus Society members will go all through the town for convention|newspaper=[[The Oregonian]]|location=Portland, Oregon|page=B4|url=http://0-infoweb.newsbank.com.catalog.multcolib.org/resources/doc/nb/news/0EB08C946874A58F?p=AMNEWS|via=[[NewsBank]]|registration=yes}}</ref> MBS is based in [[New Jersey]]<ref name="contact info">[http://www.motorbussociety.org/contact.html MBS Contact Information.] Motor Bus Society. Retrieved 2010-08-28.</ref> and maintains a small, private library and historical [[archive]] for use by its members and "serious researchers", by appointment only, in central New Jersey.<ref name="50years">"50 Years of the Motor Bus Society". ''Motor Coach Today'', January–March 1998, p. 2.</ref><ref name="archives">[http://www.motorbussociety.org/library.html The John P. Hoscheck Memorial Bus Transportation Archives.] Motor Bus Society. Retrieved 2010-08-28.</ref>
==History== Originally organized in 1948 as the '''National Motor Bus Association'''<ref name="oregonian"/> and later changing its name to the '''Motor Bus Society, Inc.''', the group's membership includes people working in the bus industry as well as bus enthusiasts, and some members fit both descriptions.<ref name="50years"/> Its newsletter soon developed into a regular magazine (see below). Every year since the early 1950s the association has held national membership [[Convention (meeting)|convention]]s, in different cities across the [[United States]] and [[Canada]]. There are normally two conventions each year, in spring and fall, one held in the eastern U.S. (or eastern Canada) and the other in the western U.S. (or Canada).<ref name="oregonian"/> As of 2000, MBS had about 1,200 members.<ref name="oregonian"/> It is incorporated in New Jersey as a type-[[501(c)|501(c)(3)]] tax-exempt, non-profit organization.<ref>[http://www.motorbussociety.org/join.html The Motor Bus Society.] Retrieved 2010-08-28.</ref>
==Magazines== The Motor Bus Society's [[magazine]], ''Motor Coach Age'' (''MCA'') (ISSN 0739-117X), has been published since 1950. For one or two years prior to that, MBS circulated a simple [[mimeograph]]ed newsletter named ''Bus Ways'', but this was replaced in January 1950 by ''Motor Coach Age'', which included photographs. ''MCA'' was changed to a professional format in 1952, with 12- to 16-page issues.<ref name="50years"/> During a period of debate among members as to the society's direction, publication of the magazine became sporadic in the late 1950s, but became regular again in 1967, when a new editor, Albert E. Meier, took over that position.<ref name="50years"/> Issues thereafter were published monthly and were each 24 pages long. During the 1980s ''MCA'' publication was variably monthly or bimonthly, then bimonthly in the early 1990s. Since the beginning of 1995, the magazine has been a quarterly publication.<ref name="50years"/> Issue size varies between 24 and 56 pages, depending on the subject.
At least since 1967, the content of ''Motor Coach Age'' has always been focused on history,<ref name="oregonian"/> documenting in detail the histories of, for example, [[bus]] transportation in particular cities or particular operating companies, or the history of a specific [[Bus manufacturing|bus manufacturer]]. Included whenever applicable are histories of electric [[Trolleybus|trolley bus]] operation and trolley bus manufacturing.
From July 1994 until the end of 2003 MBS also published ''Motor Coach Today'' (''MCT''),<ref name="index">[http://www.motorbussociety.org/mca/MCA-MCT%20Index%201950-2006.pdf Motor Coach Age & Motor Coach Today Index, 1950–2006] (PDF). Motor Bus Society. September 30, 2006. Retrieved 2010-08-28.</ref> a quarterly magazine focusing on present-day operations rather than history.
==See also== *[[Public transport bus service]] *[[Motor bus]] *[[The Motor Bus]], a poem by A. D. Godley
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *[http://www.motorbussociety.org Official website]
[[Category:Bus transport]] [[Category:History of road transport]] [[Category:Clubs and societies in the United States]] [[Category:Non-profit organizations based in New Jersey]] [[Category:Organizations established in 1948]] [[Category:Transportation associations in the United States]]

page.title: Mottos and halls of the Livery Companies

revision.text:
{{unreferenced|date=January 2018}} The [[livery company|livery companies]] of the [[City of London]] are listed below in alphabetical order, rather than by their order of precedence. Most companies' mottos are [[double entendres]] or puns about their relevant trade, and many are in [[Latin]]. Where applicable, the location of the Company's livery hall is also shown:
* [[Guild of Air Pilots and Air Navigators]]: Per Cælum Via Nostra (Our Way Is By The Heavens) * [[Worshipful Society of Apothecaries]]: Opiferque Per Orbem Dicor (I Am Called a Bringer of Help Throughout the World) ::[[Apothecaries' Hall, London|Apothecaries' Hall]]: Black Friars Lane * [[Worshipful Company of Armourers and Brasiers]]: We Are One ::Armourers' Hall: Coleman Street * [[Worshipful Company of Bakers]]: Praise God For All ::Bakers' Hall: Harp Lane * [[Worshipful Company of Barbers]]: De Praescientia Dei (From the Foreknowledge of God) ::Barbers-Surgeons' Hall: [[Wood Street, London|Wood Street]] * [[Worshipful Company of Basketmakers]]: Let Us Love One Another * [[Worshipful Company of Blacksmiths]]: By Hammer and Hand All Arts Do Stand * [[Worshipful Company of Bowyers]]: [[Battle of Crécy|Crécy]], [[Battle of Poitiers|Poitiers]], [[Battle of Agincourt|Agincourt]] * [[Worshipful Company of Brewers]]: In God Is All Our Trust ::Brewers' Hall: Aldermanbury Square * [[Worshipful Company of Broderers]]: Omnia De Super (All From Above) * [[Worshipful Company of Butchers]]: Omnia Subiecisti Sub Pedibus, Oves Et Boves (Thou Hast Put All Things Under Man's Feet, All Sheep and Oxen) ::Butchers' Hall: Bartholomew Close * [[Worshipful Company of Carmen]]: Scite, Cite, Certo (Skilfully, Swiftly, Surely) * [[Worshipful Company of Carpenters]]: Honour God ::Carpenters' Hall: Throgmorton Avenue, [[London Wall]] * [[Worshipful Company of Chartered Accountants in England and Wales|Worshipful Company of Chartered Accountants]]: True and Fair * [[Worshipful Company of Chartered Architects]]: Firmnesse, Commodite, Delyte * [[Worshipful Company of Chartered Secretaries and Administrators]]: Service with Integrity * [[Worshipful Company of Chartered Surveyors]]: Modus ab Initio (Method from the Very Beginning) * [[Worshipful Company of Clockmakers]]: Tempus Rerum Imperatur (Time is the Commander of All Things) * [[Worshipful Company of Clothworkers]]: My Trust Is in God Alone ::Clothworkers' Hall: Dunster Court, [[Mincing Lane]] * [[Worshipful Company of Coachmakers and Coach Harness Makers]]: Surgit Post Nubila Phoebus (The Sun Rises After The Clouds) * [[Worshipful Company of Cooks]]: Vulnerati Non Victi (Wounded Not Conquered) * [[Worshipful Company of Coopers]]: Love as Brethren ::Coopers' Hall: Devonshire Square * [[Worshipful Company of Cordwainers]]: Corio et Arte (Leather and Art) * [[Worshipful Company of Curriers]]: Spes Nostra Deus (Our Hope is in God) * [[Worshipful Company of Cutlers]]: Pour Parvenir A Bonne Foy (To Succeed Through Good Faith) ::Cutlers' Hall: Warwick Lane * [[Worshipful Company of Distillers]]: Drop as Rain, Distil as Dew. * [[Worshipful Company of Drapers]]: Unto God Only Be Honour and Glory ::Drapers' Hall: Throgmorton Avenue, [[Throgmorton Street]] * [[Worshipful Company of Dyers]]: Da Gloriam Deo (Give Glory to God) ::Dyers' Hall: Dowgate Hill * [[Worshipful Company of Engineers]]: Certare Ingenio (Use Skills to the Best of One's Abilities) * [[Worshipful Company of Environmental Cleaners]]: Tergere Est Servare (To Clean Is To Preserve) * [[Worshipful Company of Fan Makers]]: Arts and Trade United * [[Worshipful Company of Farmers]]: Give Us Our Daily Bread. ::Farmers' Hall: Cloth Street * [[Worshipful Company of Farriers]]: Vi et Virtute (By Strength and by Virtue) * [[Worshipful Company of Feltmakers]]: Decus et Tutamen (An Ornament and a Safeguard) * [[Worshipful Company of Fishmongers]]: Al Worship Be To God Only ::Fishmongers' Hall: [[London Bridge]] (City end) * [[Worshipful Company of Fletchers]]: True and Sure ::Fletchers' Hall: Cloth Street * [[Worshipful Company of Founders]]: God, The Only Founder ::Founders' Hall: [[Cloth Fair]] * [[Worshipful Company of Framework Knitters]]: Speed, Strength and Truth United * [[Worshipful Company of Fruiterers]]: Deus Dat Incrementum (God Gives the Increase) * [[Worshipful Company of Furniture Makers]]: ''no motto'' ::Furniture Makers' Hall: [[Austin Friars, London|Austin Friars]] * [[Worshipful Company of Gardeners]]: In The Sweat Of Thy Brows Shalt Thou Eate Thy Bread * [[Worshipful Company of Girdlers]]: Give Thanks To God ::Girdlers' Hall: Basinghall Avenue * [[Worshipful Company of Glass Sellers]]: Discordia Frangimur (Discord Weakens) * [[Worshipful Company of Glaziers and Painters of Glass]]: Lucem Tuam Da Nobis Deo (O God, Give Us Your Light) ::Glaziers' Hall: [[London Bridge]] ([[Southwark]] end) * [[Worshipful Company of Glovers]]: True Hands and Warm Hearts * [[Worshipful Company of Gold and Silver Wyre Drawers]]: Amicitiam Trahit Amor (Love Draws Friendship) * [[Worshipful Company of Goldsmiths]]: Justitia Virtutum Regina (Justice is Queen of Virtues) ::Goldsmiths' Hall: Foster Lane * [[Worshipful Company of Grocers]]: God Grant Grace ::Grocers' Hall: Princes Street * [[Worshipful Company of Gunmakers]]: ''no motto'' ::Gunmakers' Hall: [[Commercial Road]] ([[London Borough of Tower Hamlets|Tower Hamlets]]) * [[Worshipful Company of Haberdashers]]: Serve and Obey ::Haberdashers' Hall: West Smithfield * [[Worshipful Company of Horners]]: ''no motto'' * [[Worshipful Company of Information Technologists]]: Cito (Swiftly) ::Information Technologists' Hall: Bartholomew Close * [[Worshipful Company of Innholders]]: Hinc Spes Affulget (Hence Hope Shines Forth) ::Innholders' Hall: College Street * [[Worshipful Company of Insurers]]: Omnium Defensor (Protector of All) ::Insurers' Hall: Aldermanbury * [[Worshipful Company of Ironmongers]]: God Is Our Strength ::Ironmongers' Hall: Aldersgate Street * [[Worshipful Company of Joiners and Ceilers]]: Join Loyalty With Liberty * [[Worshipful Company of Launderers]]: ''no motto'' ::Launderers' Hall: [[London Bridge]] ([[Southwark]] end) * [[Worshipful Company of Leathersellers]]: Soli Deo Honor et Gloria (Honour and Glory to God Alone) ::Leathersellers' Hall: Garlick Hill * [[Worshipful Company of Loriners]]: ''no motto'' * [[Worshipful Company of Makers of Playing Cards]]: Corde Recto Elati Omnes (With an Upright Heart All Are Exalted) * [[Worshipful Company of Management Consultants]]: Change through Wisdom * [[Worshipful Company of Marketors]]: Mercatura Adiuvat Omnes (Marketing Benefits Everyone) * [[Worshipful Company of Masons]]: God is our Guide * [[Worshipful Company of Mercers]]: Honor Deo (Honour to God) ::Mercers' Hall: [[Ironmonger Lane]] * [[Worshipful Company of Merchant Taylors]]: Concordia Parvae Res Crescunt (In Harmony Small Things Grow) ::Merchant Taylors' Hall: [[Threadneedle Street]] * [[Worshipful Company of Musicians]]: Preserve Harmony * [[Worshipful Company of Needlemakers]]: They Sewed Fig Leaves Together And Made Themselves Aprons * [[Worshipful Company of Painter-Stainers]]: Amor Queat Obedientiam (Love Can Compel Obedience) ::Painters' Hall: Little Trinity Lane * [[Worshipful Company of Pattenmakers]]: Recipiunt Foeminae Sustentacula Nobis (Women Receive Support From Us) * [[Worshipful Company of Paviors]]: God Can Raise To Abraham Children of Stone * [[Worshipful Company of Pewterers]]: In God is all my Trust ::Pewterers' Hall: [[Oat Lane]] * [[Worshipful Company of Plaisterers]]: Let Brotherly Love Continue ::Plaisterers' Hall: [[London Wall]] * [[Worshipful Company of Plumbers]]: Justicia Et Pax (Justice and Peace) * [[Worshipful Company of Poulters]]: Remember Your Oath * [[Worshipful Company of Saddlers]]: Hold Fast, Sit Sure; Our Trust Is In God ::Saddlers' Hall: Gutter Lane * [[Worshipful Company of Salters]]: Sal Sapit Omnia ("Salt seasons everything"; implies that "Wit improves discourse") ::Salters' Hall: Fore Street * [[Worshipful Company of Scientific Instrument Makers]]: Sine Nobis Scientia Languet (Science Languishes Without Us) ::Scientific Instrument Makers' Hall: Montague Close ([[Southwark]]) * [[Worshipful Company of Scriveners]]: Scribite Scientes (Write, Ye Learned Ones) - formerly Litera Scripta Manet (The Written Word Remains) Clerk of the Company * [[Worshipful Company of Shipwrights]]: Within the Ark Safe Forever * [[Worshipful Company of Skinners]]: To God Only Be All Glory ::Skinners' Hall: Dowgate Hill * [[Worshipful Company of Spectacle Makers]]: A Blessing to the Aged * [[Worshipful Company of Stationers and Newspaper Makers]]: Verbum Domini Manet in Eternum (The Word of the Lord Endures Forever) ::Stationers' Hall: [[Ave Maria Lane]] * [[Worshipful Company of Tallow Chandlers]]: Ecce Agnus Dei Qui Tollit Peccata Mundi (Behold the Lamb of God, Who Takes Away the Sins of the World) ::Tallow Chandlers' Hall: Dowgate Hill * [[Worshipful Company of Tax Advisers]]: Veritas, Caritas, Comitas (Truth, Charity, Fellowship) * [[Worshipful Company of Tin Plate Workers]]: Amore Sitis Uniti (Be United In Love) * [[Worshipful Company of Tobacco Pipe Makers and Tobacco Blenders]]: Producat Terra (Out of the Earth) * [[Worshipful Company of Turners]]: By Faith I Obteigne * [[Worshipful Company of Tylers and Bricklayers]]: In God Is All Our Trust * [[Worshipful Company of Upholders]]: Sustine Bona (Uphold the Good) * [[Worshipful Company of Vintners]]: Vinum Exhilarat Animum (Wine Cheers the Mind) ::Vintners' Hall: [[Thames Street (London)|Upper Thames Street]] * [[Worshipful Company of Water Conservators]] : Nulla vita sine aqua (No life without water) * [[Worshipful Company of Wax Chandlers]]: Truth is the Light ::Wax Chandlers' Hall: [[Gresham Street]] * [[Worshipful Company of Weavers]]: Weave Truth With Trust * [[Worshipful Company of Wheelwrights]]: God Grant Unity * [[Worshipful Company of Woolmen]]: Lana Spes Nostra (Wool Is Our Hope) * [[Worshipful Company of World Traders]]: Commerce and honest friendship with all
{{DEFAULTSORT:Mottos and halls of the Livery Companies}} [[Category:Livery companies]] [[Category:Lists of mottos|Livery Companies]]

revision.text:
[[File:National Emergency Number Association logo.png|right]] The '''National Emergency Number Association''' (NENA) is an organization whose mission it is to foster the technological advancement, availability, and implementation of a universal [[emergency telephone number]] system in the United States. In carrying out its mission, NENA promotes [[research]], planning, training and [[education]]. The protection of human life, the preservation of [[property]] and the maintenance of general community security are among NENA's objectives.
One of NENA's main functions is to grade the quality of the [[9-1-1]] (the Universal Emergency Number since 1968) services that exist throughout the [[United States of America]]. Through their Report Card to the Nation (RCN), the RCN Commission reviews and grades the performance of 9-1-1 centers based on their established standards of practice. NENA is tracking the deployment of [[Enhanced 9-1-1]] and the Wireless Phase 1 and 2 initiatives. The latter are enabling 9-1-1 call takers to (in Phase 1) identify the cell tower related to the caller and (in Phase 2) to identify the actual geographic location of the caller.
==External links== * {{official website|http://www.nena.org}}
